Posts.Content: LB2008 wrote: Hi, I'm hoping someone could help me. I had my first mammogram on Monday. (I'm 38). I just got a call today saying that they found "tiny calcifications" on my left breast. They scheduled me at another office for a second mammogram but it's not for another 11 days from now! I will be calling every day starting tomorrow to see if they can get me in earlier. Anyway, I know nothing about this but the nurse told me 80% of these are benign. Well, that still leaves me with 20% that are not. I read up on these "tiny calcifications" and it looks like the small ones like these have more chance of being cancerous. Can anyone help me with this, I'm a nervous wreck and have very little knowledge about "calcifications". Thank you for your time! Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Please help, just joined LB2008 Dukemom2

Posts.Content: Nov 9, 2008 03:08PM LB2008 wrote: Hello, They just found a cluster of microcalcifications in my left breast. I was also rated Birad 4 which means "suspicious" and warrants a biopsy. I had a Stereotactic Biopsy on Wednesday and they called me Thursday and they are B9! I just have to go back in 6 months for a follow-up!  They told me most are benign. When they rate it Birad 4 it just means they can't tell by looking at the film if it's benign or not. Best of luck, if you have any questions please let me know. I know how scary it is since I just went through it but I will keep my fingers crossed that you will be B9 too!

Posts.Content: LB2008 wrote: Hi, I just had my follow-up mammogram today. My baseline was last week. I am 38. They told me I had calcifications. Today I found out that they are microcalcifications. They showed me the film which indicated approx. 4-6 clustered white dots on the mammo. My xrays are a Birad 4. I am scheduled for a Stereotactic Core biopsy tomorrow. They said 80% are benign but 20% are not. I am very scared. I had posted here a few days ago after my first mammo and was hoping it wasn't going to come to this. Has anyone else had the "clustered microcalcifications"? I have read online that these are the worst kind. I'd like to hear peoples outcomes. They kept saying "don't worry they are very common" but I will have to see.  Please help!!!!!!!!!!!! Log in to post a reply
